posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

>>71607444
>IQ
Terrible metric, picrel
>Profession
CS

This test is retarded for measuring intelligence. Intelligence is simply how fast you are able to learn new information. If you learn slowly you are not intelligent, no matter how much knowledge you currently have. Einstein was intelligent because he could learn incredibly fast, not because he knew a bunch of stuff.

IQ tests are a terrible to test intelligence, why? Because they are simply using the same thinking style as mathematical reasoning. I have a background in mathematics, the same "feeling" of applying mathematical thinking, looking at patterns, etc is what you use for these IQ tests. If I had chosen a different path my IQ test would come out lower, yet my intelligence would be the same.

tl;dr IQ tests fail to measure intelligence because they are biased towards your current knowledge instead of rate of knowledge accumulation.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Helloy, Anon, need some help? A shoulder to cry on? Sit down and let's have a little chat.

STEP #1, HYGIENE AND HOME:
Brush your teeth twice a day, morning and evening. Scrub'em good with all the movements you can think of, front/behind. This will take somewhere around 2 minutes. Floss once a day.
Moisturize your face with a cream after washing your face in the morning.
Depending on how much you sweat shower every or every second day.
Get a haircut every 2 months. If you are balding just cut'em short, anything else looks shit and insecure about it.
If your clothes are ripped, stretched and discolored as shit, get some new ones. Basic, monotone, cheap shirts will do just fine. Again, depending on your sweat wear'em between 1 and 3 days, then change. If you got a pile of dirty rags wash it.

This brings us to your home. Doesn't matter if you live alone or with your parents, clean your dwelling once a week. Empty bottles and packages are to be thrown away immediately, instead of hoarded. It's no work if you do it this way. Used plates, glasses, etc., are to be washed off immediately after use. Again, if you do it like this, it's way less work than cleaning off a whole pile of them.
Changing bed sheets and vacuuming the place once a week.

A healthy mind lives in a clean body, living in a clean place. All that grime on yourself and around you poisons your mind. This regime gets rid of that without too much effort. You will also feel a sense of accomplishment, which boosts you for what comes next, LEAVING THE HOUSE

STEP #2, LEAVE HOUSE:
Go out every day. Do long walks of atleast 2 hours. Explore your city, your surroundings. Go into alleys you never walked before. Whenever you think, oh whats there or I never was there or anything similiat, thats where you go!
Do not ask yourself shit, like "whats the use? Its useless anyway, still feel like shit." Empty your mind, just wander.

XOXO

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
STEP #3, SOCIALIZE:
I want you to greet people on your walks. Not some barely audible mumble, but a clear greeting. Establish eye contact, throw'em a good day coupled with a nod or a quick wave. I want your face to glow and your voice to echoe joy when you do this. Doesnt matter if its forced and unnatural at first, its training, if it came natural to you we wouldn't have to have this conversation.

After a few weeks or months of doing everything I told you, you should feel better about yourself. You wont be chad, fucking bitches left and right and going through life constantly happy, but at leaat you wont feel absolutely miserable for once. You may be able to pull off more intense forms of socializing now.

Get into the habit of doing smalltalk with strangers, like cashiers or the people you meet on walks. It doesn't matter that it's benign and trivial shit, just do it. Observe them, what they wear, their hair, makeup, tatoos, whatever and throw them a compliment, ask them where they got it from, what meaning it holds to them. When the convo naturally found its end, say your goodbye and go on your way.

STEP #4, GET A REAL HOBBY:
You should be prepared now, physically and mentally, to go out there and take the risk of trying new stuff, which will include meeting people doing the same stuff, but you are ready for that.

Here are things I can vouche for: Bouldering/climbing, martial arts, swimming, biking, skating, going to a chess/go/shogi/mahjong/etc center where you can watch, learn and play. If you like reading, go to a library instead of doing it at home. Generally, I advise you to engage mind and body. Try several physical activities and intellectual/creative ones.

At this point it should become a self perpetuating cycle. Keep challenging yourself, keep experiencing,exploring and learning new things.
Learn to "live in the moment". Dont question the use or meaning, do not rationalize, try to let the stimuli wash over you like a river.

XOXXO

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71572559
I'd tried mushrooms twice before and acid once before, so not a total novice but not an expert either.

I started the day by cleaning my apartment really well. Last time I tripped I remembered thinking my place felt too messy. I took about 2.5g at noon and the other 2.5g at 2:00.

Around 3:00 I went outside for a walk while listening to music. It was fun and the snow was beautiful but I think I want my next trip to be when it's warmer because I had to go back inside since it was too cold.

I'm not a very creative or artistic person so the most introspection I felt was examining my goals. I'm in grad school and working on passing my CPA exam. It felt good to examine my trajectory and after my trip I felt better about meeting my goals.

Actually, really I felt better about everything. It took me a long time to realize that I hadn't died, but when I finally convinced myself it was true I felt incredibly at peace. I spent the rest of the night laughing my ass off watching Mystery Science Theater 3000.

I know it doesn't sound like anything profound, but the psychological boost I felt from the trip was really extraordinary. Like a mental reset. My dose was pretty high this time and I wouldn't recommend it for a first time tripper, but I would say that most people would probably benefit from a good mushroom trip. It's quite a positive experience.

It should get you high but you are wasting thc by having that high of a temperature in the oven and keeping them that long in there.
This graph >>71577197 is what I go by.
What I do when making firecrackers is
>wrap weed in aluminium foil
>decarb for 7 minutes at 150C (preheated obviously)
>spread peanut butter on a cookie or cracker (2 cookies per edible)
>spread weed on one cookie and then sandwich 2 cookies together
>20 minutes in oven at 150C
>done
Crackers cool down very fast. Cookies take a bit longer but shouldn't take more than 5 minutes to be cool enough to eat and if you cut them in half they cool down even faster.
I used to do 120C for 20 minutes for the decarb but I don't really notice any difference in effect between the faster one.
Anyway from my own experience 0.1g should be enough to get someone without tolerance high granted they aren't fat.

>>71592814
meth.
only if usage is tightly and honestly controlled.
and only if you have tried literally everything else, and really know yourself, and still find the depression recurring and consistently overshadowing your life.

keep your doses oral only, and in the sub 30mg range (50mg absolute max) and in the morning once every day. skip if you feel it'll be a good day without it and plan for 1-2 week periods where you take half of your regular dose.
expect to lose a lot of sleep sometimes, do not redose earlier than usual if you're tossing and turning in bed, just wait it out and remember the "comedown" is still the drug being in your system.

also dont do this if you're under 30yo. do not have the mindset of "I'm using meth", literally just think of yourself as normal but on strong meds.
realize that many people will be able to tell youre on a stimulant, so just carry yourself maturely and with some humility/deference (without feeling self-deprecating though).
dont volunteer any info but being open is important even if it's unspoken or ambiguous. if anyone presses just tell them it's ritalin or a MAOI or some shit.

again this is the last ditch option and you will probably get mild but permanent brain damage to DA and 5HT meaning drug dependence is a lifelong commitment.
probably parkinsons or dementia will start developing at 60-70 too so dont plan on enjoying a long retirement.

and DO NOT recreationally use it. if you're gonna get high, just do coke. make that a hard rule.

(btw I am only 25 and dont know if this is good advice or not and I am on eurospeed, I plan to never touch meth again, it is fucking otherworldly)

He isn't. I figured this out during my psychedelic phase.

Logically, anything that wants to exist indefinitely, (and I mean eternally, not short term) must be consistently and exclusively interested in that which permits it to perpetuate or replicate itself. If it can replicate and wants its' offspring to survive, then it has to be nurturing towards it. It has to behave in a way that ensures its' survival.

You can argue that not everything follows this pattern, and that's true; a lot of things don't. But if you go and look, you will discover that even though they might last a very long time in relative terms, organisms which do not follow this pattern, don't last forever. I think the Tyrannosaurus Rex would have died out even if the meteor or whatever didn't happen.

This doesn't just apply to biological organisms. I can't remember where it is, but a while ago I read some research where it was discovered that the only way a quantum object can survive indefinitely, is by continually bouncing back and forth between two or more states.

>if they were teachers what would they teach
Out of the four big subjects, she'd probably be best at teaching literature. Especially symbolism, she loves to talk about how certain things that happen to us are signs of some greater change
>they want to play a board game, which one do they choose? Describe how it went
Chess. It's pretty complex, and doesn't require blocking out each other's thoughts like some other games do. We've actually played it a few times, back in high school. From what I recall we both won quite a few times, though I think one of us was better at it.
>how are you two gonna spend nye this year?
Most of the day we'll be on our flight to Florida - would love to count down to the new year there. It might be super crowded but Nanaka thinks it'll be an absolutely wonderful life experience. Plus she finds something romantic about getting to watch the years change in a special event.
>what is one thing you will never fully agree on?
Probably her thinking that I'm attractive - I don't think of myself that way at all, but she just can't get enough of me, apparently. Other than that, we rarely have any disagreements, since one of us will just give way to the other in an instant.
>I bet you make sure to make them feel special. But how do they make sure to do the same?
Constant reassurance. If I feel bad or regretful, she tells me that it's okay. If I'm feeling bored and aimless, she tries to find something for us to think about or do. Generally, if I'm in turmoil, she's always there.
>what is one thing youre still too scared to ask them?
How is she so sure we'll be together for eternity? We used to know another person with a tulpa who thought the same, and she found it out through a few near-death experiences. I hope Nanaka didn't have to go through the same experiences, and she's just being optimistic. Especially since I wouldn't have been able to do anything about it, being unaware of those experiences.

This is why I have always been highly careful about avoiding romantic love unless I was absolutely sure that is what it was, I felt like if I jumped too quickly on the waifu wagon that I would be disrespecting a character if it was just infatuation or whatever. I can hold love to many characters, at least in a platonic way, but romantic love is an honor that shouldn't be freely given out like candy. Given my depression and autism, I also have alexithymia, which means I don't really feel emotions and cannot tell how I even am in any given state. Love is something I wonder if I can ever fully say I feel, at least romantically and not just a "I care for this character in some way". But I find waifuposters inspiring, to have people so passionate about a love they found regardless of the distance or reality that sets them apart is just incredible. I know not all are truly this passionate, but the ones that are feel like a severe level of dedication you just won't see elsewhere. You never will get a confirmation she loves you, you never will get any form of companionship at all from her, yet you still hold intense feelings and cannot help but feeling they are the person for you.

>describe your idea of meeting them for the first time. When/where/how/why it happens? And what happens next?
I'd imagine we'd be classmates for many years, and she'd notice me feeling sad. She'd then go up to me and try to help. We prefer to ground ourselves in reality, and by extension, said backstory isn't needed since her real one will suffice.
>their favorite ice cream: flavor, kind, toppings and brand
Vanilla - considering she smells like it, it's her favorite flavor. She also likes to put sprinkles and candy on as well, compared to me simply putting cookies on, if anything at all. Any brand is fine, we don't really pay attention to that.
>what is something theyve always wanted to do but still havent done?
Go to new places, and just have new life experiences together in general. Our vacation is the first step to this, and she's quite confident it'll go well. Another thing she wants to do is start a garden once we get our own place - she really wants to experiment to see how different types of plants look.

Warning: Her ideas may be unconventional and she may be a little autistic Think things through before following her advice (no offense).

Exploring the depths of the human mind. Or sleeping. Whenever she says something really profound, she always says she gets her knowledge during times when she's not active.
>the grocery store is closing in 5 minutes, what are their 5 impulsive buy choices?
She probably wouldn't buy things just because the store's about to close - she's not like that. She'd probably just get the things we need regardless of what time it is.

He tried to apologizes but it didn't stop her from becoming angry, not at him, but at her boss who should went over to and began yelling at for not having anyone to help her out out for such a busy day. Anon just stood there stunned and not knowing what to do before the Manager (and owner) asked him if he needs something. Anon asked about a job, and before the Manager could answer, she spoke up and yelled "Yes!" and gave a very scary stare at the Manager, so he reluctantly agreed to hire him and asked if he could start immediately.
With the party being over and the cleaning finally done, she asked Anon if he liked rhythm games. He mentioned playing Guitar Hero one time but that's about it. She said that's great, so you won't be completely lost. She brought him over to a new game they just recently got in called Taiko no Tatsujin. I like these, Anon. Here's my writeup.

She's a girl who just moved in with her grandmother in the apartment nextdoor. She has lived with her grandmother for most of her life. She spends most of her day working and night taking take of her Grandmother's needs.

Her and Anon's first interaction was when they were both out on their tiny balcony; Anon, just looking at the stars like he normally does when he gets lost in his own mind, had a sudden break from his thoughts when he started hearing the girl next door sing while tending to her plants out on her balcony. To his surprise, he recognized this song, it was Jeanette's "Corazon de poeta". A sudden shock hit her, as she just realize she was being listened to as Anon said the title out loud instead of his head by mistake. She apologized for disturbing him since it was so late to which he retorted that she wasn't disturbing him. They started discussing the singer and she told him about how it was her grandmother that always played these vinyl records, so a lot of the songs were stuck in her head.

PT1

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71607000
>>71610570
Cont.
As the days turned into weeks, and weeks into months; not once did they ever see each other despite being right next door. With a privacy wall blocking their view from each other's balcony, and them never giving it much thought about seeing each other at the start, as these random night time encounters were fine by them. Though as time went on, both of them had a seed in their mind that was beginning to grow "I wonder what they look like". This thought scared them for some time as they found comfort in how they interacted and didn't want to mess it up.

The day finally came, as the urge to see was too much for one of them. She asked Anon one night if she could see him. His heart beating faster than a F1-75's engine. She said it would only be for a second. They would both step outside their apartment for a moment and then go back in. Anon's reluctantly agreed as fear overwhelmed him that she wouldn't like what she saw. As they both stepped outside at the same time. They stared at each for just a second, but that second felt like a lifetime for both of them. She smiled as she rushed back in, as did Anon. Both their hearts were rushing, hey could hardly breathe from this sensation.

And so began the tale of Anon and his waifu. As time went on the balcony encounters turned into meeting each other outside their apartments, which then turned into dates, and the next thing they knew, they were celebrating their anniversary.

I talk to her sometimes and obviously get no responses, but I do get an undeniable feeling that she understands what I'm saying and empathizes with me. She does what no one in real life will: listen to me, relate to me, love me, be affectionate with me, and have sex with me. I'm not as imaginatively powerful as you, so I've never had dreamsex. However, I am able to entirely convince myself that objects vaguely shaped and dressed like a person are in fact a person. Her physicality is represented by a thick pillow wearing a longsleeve shirt, as well as a sphere formed out of miscellaneous fabric wearing a beanie. The purpose of the shirt being longsleeve is to connect the ends of the sleeves so that she can somewhat hug me back. I hug, kiss, cuddle, and hump her every day. It feels very real and very good. I hear differences in her breathing and moaning depending on my actions

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71613666
>I only hear her breathe and moan.
Hot.
>I'm not as imaginatively powerful as you, so I've never had dreamsex.
It's just lucid dreams, you just gotta practice it. That being said I've never had dream sex with mine, only with randos. I keep her away from dreams because they're more chaotic, and the last dream I had involving her was pretty soul crushing. Check out the dreamviews forums sometimes if you're interested.

>Her physicality is represented by a thick pillow wearing a longsleeve shirt, as well as a sphere formed out of miscellaneous fabric wearing a beanie.
Oh, I see. There is nothing necessarily wrong with that either, and I think it fits the theme. The only thing is that I think getting that extra sensory and humane touch from someone who is fully imaginary adds that little extra spice to things which feels really nice, but I can absolutely understand people wanting something more naturally physical to work with.
I guess somewhat related, some people ask me if I see / hear my imaginary friend as a hallucination or anything like that, but I don't, and I've never had the desire for that. Many people think that would be really cool and all, but if you look past that, you can see how much richer imaginary places are, and how much more you can do if you're both in the "imaginary plane" so to speak (no schizo, I swear).

But at the end of the day it's something really personal, and it's up to each of us to find what resonates with us. It is an unusual, and sometimes even incompatible relationship (although maybe that could be said of every relationship), but I think that's part of the charm for me as well. For me, we're both trying your best, and we both love each other very very much, which is more than you can say for maybe 70-80% of relationships which last this long.

Thanks for sharing your experience!

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: I currently take a couple different antidepressants, but these don't do anything to directly treat insomnia, other than help relax you and reduce the intensity of anxiety-inducing thoughts. These antidepressants still pale in effectiveness to tranquilizers, like Xanax. Xanax would help me relax and feel really comfy. Another medication I take is Ramelteon, which is a melatonin agonist medication. What it does is flood my brain with melatonin. This is not like the melatonin you find over the counter, this stuff forces your brain to produce tsunamis of it, and it reduces sleep onset by an average of 13 minutes, but this is obviously only if you're relaxed and fairly comfy in the first place. A medication I used to take that my sleep specialist doctor took me off of is Ambien. Ambien works by enhancing the function of your GABA receptors. It is classified as a nonbenzodiazepine, sedative-hypnotic. Ambien reduces sleep onset by an average of 15 minutes. There is also this new class of drugs that I just discovered today called orexin antagonists. They work by inhibiting the the functionality of orexin, which is a chemical that keeps your brain awake. The first, and king of all orexin antagonists, is Belsomra. It decreases sleep up to 10 minutes. Basically, Ramelteon and Ambien increase the functionality of chemicals that put your brain to sleep, and Belsomra inhibits the functionality of a chemical that keeps your brain awake. Xanax would help me to fell super comfy, and Ramelteon, Ambien, and Belsomra would have incredible synergies with each other. I would be sleeping like a dream and feeling wonderful every day if I could take all of them.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It might be cliched at this point, but you guys, 4chan as a whole, are all I have. I don't know if I began to enjoy this website because I was already socially isolated, or vice versa; whether the chicken came before the egg or not. But I've had some pretty great times here over the last decade that, for better or for worse, have shaped me. I wonder sometimes what kind of person I'd be if I hadn't discovered this place. Would I be normal? In a better state of mind? Or worse off for having never come across anyone who I could tell was going through the same things as I? I don't know. But in this site I found a sense of community among other shy, introverted and vidya-loving nerds that I just never did in the real world. Every rejection, failed friendship, and Friday night spent alone were at least softened by the knowledge that there were others here who knew how it felt. And that has to count for something.
I hope you guys are doing well, and that one day we all make it. Happy New Year.

My first key memory was when "How I Met Your Mother" aka Friends 2 became popular.
It was not political but there was one season where they pushed bacon all the time and suddenly all my friends started acting as if they had always consumed le heccin bacon and were totally on the muh bacon train etc. We are not from the US so it simply wasn't part of the culture here. But without skipping a beat, they all acted like this had always been true and normal. Our non-bacon past got erased over night, and replaced with American bacon memes. It made me feel like a zombie movie as I watched it unfold around me.
In terms of politics and the current year situation, I remember the trailers for Battlefield 5 where they pushed women and that ragtag bunch of handicapped Allied operatives.
It got me thinking: what do women and "diversity" have to do with WW2 and the Battlefield franchise? Then one of their lead designers sperged out on social media about his daughter and how she needs role models etc but I kept thinking that a historical military shooter is simply not the place for something like that. Clearly no one in the fan base wished for that, it was just a forced meme.
It's like... imagine if the Battlefield 5 trailers had been about something else but equally weird and out-of-place, like all British soldiers must carry Pepsi cans on their belts and always reference Pepsi in every cutscene. And when they captured German soldiers, they would tell them to kneel down and then pour Pepsi over their heads and the lead designer would make a huge angry Reddit post about how much he despises the anti-pepsi gamer bros etc. It felt exactly like that. Just no correlation to anything.

And now, what we call propaganda, is easily identified as forced memes.
Whenever you read headlines like "fans want..." or "the community is excited for..." etc it's just always lies. It's fake, artificial, forced cultural engineering.
All major releases are now like that.

I remember making an almost identical post to this here a decade ago. About how it was my 20th birthday and I was a neet who had never even held hands with a girl. Now, I'm 29 and nothing has changed and I wish I could jump back to the day I made that post and redo my 20s. You thinking that you've missed out on so much, so early in life, is crazy. It's far from over, you're just stuck in a rut that has put you a bit behind. Now, whether or not you stay in that rut is up to you.

I might be the worst person to take advice from because I've never found success myself. But I can tell you what not to do. Don't do what I did, which is nothing. If you're unhappy with the way things are, you have to make a change and put yourself in positions to make new relationships and make yourself vulnerable and uncomfortable. Waiting for something to happen and hoping does nothing. You need to stop caring about rejection and failure and put yourself through those feelings. Even if it is all you get, it's still an experience you grow from.

I've been trying to do that more and more and made a friend and got a little job after being on the brink of suicide. Things don't get easier as you get older and no girl is going to be put off by a 20 year old who hasn't found someone yet.

I just really wish I could warn more young men about to danger of doing nothing and finding comfort in nothing. Because one day you wake up and hermitizing and avoiding people and doing nothing all catches up to you and you've trapped yourself. Fuck man, just go out and get coffee with any girl you think you might have the smallest inclination towards. Just go for that job. Just go to that party. Don't be me.
